about_the_game:
The story takes place in late 19th century Japan...

Can you realize the truth about the black thing, the flower, that appears in the mansion? Your choice will reveal the truth...

This is a horror game played in FPS (First Person Viewpoint).

[Story]

In the 1880's... “Minako Katanari”, who was still of low status, was sent as a servant to the “Kamen family”, a noble family.

However, the house was full of black things and the history of the Kamenke family, which was in a terrible state of disrepair...

In order to find out the truth, Minako is forced to go into a history that she is not allowed to enter.

There is more than one ending.

Operation

Move/WASD

Running: Shift Left

Interact/Left click

Item/TAB

Special key/Q

■Video Distribution Guidelines

Users may submit videos in accordance with the following guidelines.

There are no restrictions on video submission sites or applications, but please do not submit videos to sites or applications that may be involved in adult content, etc. No confirmation is required when posting videos. Editing is also allowed.

We also allow videos that combine the contributor's face, body, V, etc.

Thumbnails, etc. with titles or play images are also acceptable.

However, the following conditions must be observed.

(1) Do not use misleading thumbnails, videos, or content.

(2) You must include a link to the dead flowers on STEAM in the summary section or in a place where it can be written.

(3) Do not use dead calving flowers and do not infringe on the rights of third parties.

(4)If all of those conditions are not met, the video or content must be deleted immediately.

■Prohibitions

(1) Making religious or political statements in videos or contents.

(2) Unauthorized reproduction of videos or contents posted by third parties.

If you do not abide by these prohibitions and conditions, we will ask you to delete the video/content.

That is all.

(On a personal note, I started making this game when I was in junior high school, so I may be slow to respond to bugs. I am really sorry about that, but please bear with me).
